#Text=Build a Backyard
#Text=Vertical Farm
#Text=Vertical farms are a new and extremely innovative way to grow crops .
#Text=You may not know that you can have one right outside your home , and can build it yourself with minimum effort !

#Text=This wikiHow will show you how to build 2 different kinds of vertical farms within your own backyard , one being easy and small-scale ( with PVC pipe ) , and the other being a little more intensive and bigger ( with a full pallet ) .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Using PVC Pipe
#Text=Stay safe .
#Text=You will need safety equipment including , but not limited to , safety glasses , protective clothing , and even earplugs .
#Text=( This is only if you plan to drill holes in PVC pipes yourself as opposed to buying them . )
#Text=Find the perfect spot for your vertical farm .
#Text=Gather your materials .
#Text=This includes :
#Text=4”-6 ” PVC pipes - as many as needed - with holes spaced evenly throughout ( can buy these at a DIY/hardware store or can drill holes yourself )
#Text=An end cap for PVC pipe mentioned above , for stabilization and balance ( Can also buy these at a DIY/hardware store )
#Text=Rocks ( to weigh down PVC pipe to stay in place )
#Text=Soil ( to plant the crops in )
#Text=And finally , the crops you would like to grow .
#Text=Use ones that have grown for a week or two , but are not in ‘ full bloom ’ .

#Text=These cannot be seeds , because they will need to grow out of the holes we have drilled in the PVC pipe , and seeds can grow in any direction and run into the inside of the pipe , rendering them useless .
#Text=Glue the end cap to your PVC pipe , and let it sit for about 10 minutes to strengthen the bond .
#Text=Put the smaller sized rocks into the PVC pipe , about ⅓ of the way full .
#Text=Fill up PVC pipe with soil , leaving about ½ ” of the top empty .
#Text=Fill up PVC pipe with soil , leaving about ½ ” of the top empty .
#Text=Water regularly ( based on the specific crops needs ) and watch your vertical farm thrive !
#Text=Using a Pallet
#Text=Stay safe .
#Text=As with the previous method , you will need safety equipment including , but not limited to , safety glasses , protective clothing , and even earplugs .
#Text=( This is only if you plan on putting together the pallet yourself as opposed to buying it ! ) .
#Text=You will also need a pallet , a small roll of landscape fabric , a staple gun , sandpaper , and finally 2 large bags of potting soil .
#Text=Free the pallet of debris .
#Text=Before you can plant these crops , you need to make sure our pallet is free of any chipped wood or loose nails .
#Text=Use the sandpaper to smooth over any potentially sharp and dangerous nails or pieces of wood .
#Text=Find the perfect location for your vertical farm .
#Text=It can stand it up against a wall or tree ; you could find a wall to place it on , and drill screws into wall to hold up the pallet .
#Text=These will need to be strong , because the pallet will be much heavier than you think with it is filled with soil !
#Text=Install the landscape fabric .
#Text=Choose which side of your pallet will be shown , because you will be covering the back , sides , and bottom of it .
#Text=( You do n’t want any soil falling out ! )
#Text=Lay pallet face down and completely cover it with landscape fabric .
#Text=You may need to cover twice .
#Text=You will need to make sure the fabric is going to stay there , so pull out your staple gun and staple it towards the top edge and corners of the board !
#Text=Make sure to pull the fabric and make it completely flat , leaving few to no ridges or bumps .
#Text=Staple roughly every 1 ½ ” - 2 ” .
#Text=Repeat this process on every side of the pallet until back and sides are completely covered in the fabric .
#Text=Staple some more .
#Text=Make sure to staple anywhere that the soil may be able to come out !
#Text=( Put as many as you think you need ; There is no wrong answer ! )
#Text=Pour soil over the pallet .
#Text=Use your hands to stuff it inside , completely filling it and making it as tight as you can .
#Text=Plant the crops in the soil , just like you would if they were in the ground .
#Text=Water regularly .
#Text=Water your farm based on the needs of the specific crop .
#Text=Watch your vertical farm thrive !
#Text=Tips
#Text=Make sure the crops you plan on growing can effectively grow in your living climate !
#Text=Warnings
#Text=If you are not going to build the pallet yourself , make sure upon obtaining it that you are able to .
#Text=Do not simply find one outside of a building and take it without permission !
